intro: Psychotria canescens, commonly known as the white psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and undergrowth. The species is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
